requirements.text: The Vital_Signs_Monitor shall measure the patient heart rate with an accuracy of ±2 bpm across the range of 30 to 250 bpm.
requirements.rationale: IEC 60601-2-27 accuracy requirement for ECG monitoring.

requirements.text: The SpO2_Sensor shall measure blood oxygen saturation with an accuracy of ±2% in the range of 70% to 100% SpO2.
The Alarm_Module shall generate an audible alarm within 5 ± 0.5 seconds of detecting a vital sign parameter outside the configured threshold.
requirements.rationale: IEC 60601-1-8 general alarm standard for medical devices.

requirements.text: The Device shall operate continuously for a minimum of 72 hours on a single battery charge under normal monitoring conditions.
requirements.rationale: Clinical workflow requires 3-day monitoring without recharging.

requirements.text: The Data_Transmission_Module shall transmit each vital sign reading to the Nurse_Station via Bluetooth Low Energy 5.0 with a maximum latency of 1000 ± 100 ms.
requirements.rationale: Clinical decision support requires near-real-time data.

requirements.text: The Encryption_Engine shall encrypt each patient health record using AES-256 in compliance with HIPAA §164.312(a)(2)(iv).
requirements.rationale: Protected health information requires encryption at rest and in transit.

requirements.text: The Device shall withstand ingress of water per IEC 60529 IP67 rating.
requirements.rationale: Clinical environment includes exposure to fluids and cleaning agents.

requirements.text: The User_Interface shall display each vital sign value in a font size no smaller than 14 mm height at a viewing distance of 1 m.
requirements.rationale: IEC 62366-1 usability requirement for clinical readability.

requirements.text: The Device shall detect each lead-off condition within 2 ± 0.2 seconds of electrode disconnection and alert the user.
requirements.rationale: False alarm reduction and patient safety during monitoring.

requirements.text: The Device shall complete a full self-test sequence within 30 ± 5 seconds of power-on, verifying each sensor and communication module.
requirements.rationale: Pre-use verification per IEC 62304 software lifecycle.

decisions.title: IEC 62304 Class C software classification
decisions.desc: Device software classified as Class C (could result in death or serious injury).
decisions.rationale: Vital sign monitoring directly influences clinical decisions.

decisions.title: BLE 5.0 over Wi-Fi for bedside telemetry
decisions.desc: Selected Bluetooth Low Energy 5.0 over Wi-Fi for nurse station communication.
decisions.rationale: Lower power consumption extends battery life; sufficient bandwidth for vital signs data.

risks.title: False alarm fatigue
risks.desc: High false alarm rate may cause clinical staff to ignore or disable alarms.
risks.mitigation: Smart alarm algorithm with patient-specific baselines; IEC 60601-1-8 compliance.

risks.title: Cybersecurity breach of patient data
risks.desc: Unauthorized access to PHI via BLE or stored data.
risks.mitigation: AES-256 encryption, BLE pairing with PIN, HIPAA compliance audit.

risks.title: Skin irritation from prolonged electrode contact
risks.desc: Extended wear may cause contact dermatitis or pressure injury.

useCases.name: Continuous Patient Monitoring
useCases.trigger: Nurse applies electrodes and powers on device
useCases.preconditions: Device charged, electrodes available, nurse station gateway online
useCases.mainFlow:
1. Nurse applies electrodes to patient
2. Nurse powers on device
3. Device runs self-test (30s)
4. Device begins continuous monitoring
5. Vital signs transmitted to nurse station at 1 Hz
6. Alarms triggered if thresholds exceeded
7. Nurse reviews data on station display
useCases.postconditions: Patient monitored, data recorded, alarms active
